thread.title: Newnan, ECHS look to advance against 2- opponents
thread.title_full: Newnan, ECHS look to advance against 2- opponents

title: Newnan, ECHS look to advance against 2- opponents
text:
Comments 
When the GHSA Class softball tournament opens today in the best-of-three series, the East Coweta Lady Indians will play the first round at home against Lakeside-DeKalb, while the Newnan Lady Cougars travel to Covington against Newton. 
East Coweta (28-2) captured the Region 3- tournament last week to earn the No. 1 seed after beating South Cobb in the championship. 
For East Coweta and Newnan, the best-of-three series is the first step to getting back to the GHSA Elite 8 Tournament in Columbus. 
Newnan (16-10) lost to both East Coweta and South Cobb in the tournament and earned the No. 3 seed. 
East Coweta head coach Franklin DeLoach has won 10 region titles and heads back to the state tournament with plenty of depth, including three pitchers who have all started at various times this season. 
Morgan Goree brings the most experience to the circle, while freshman Kelley Lynch and sophomore Rachel Vaughan have also pitched the Lady Indians to wins. 
Lynch hit three home runs during the region tournament and also pitched a no-hitter against Westlake. 
East Coweta's Dani Morgan moved to town in time of her senior year, and the shortstop, who is headed to Florida State, has shown her ability with her glove and bat. 
The Lady Indians enter the Class tournament on a 13-game winning streak, including eight by shutout. 
Lakeside-DeKalb, earned the No. 3 seed out of Region 2- . The Lady Vikings knocked off Tucker 
15-6 in their last outing. Sarah Parker and Tessa Walker lead the team with 11 RBIs. Megan Lohry and Clare Hunter have shared the pitching load for Lakeside. 
The Region 2- tournament was rained out, so seeding at the state tournament was based on the order of finish in the regular season. 
The winner of the East Coweta-Lakeside contest plays the winner of the Collins Hill-North Forsyth game in a best-of-three series next week. 
Newnan takes on a Newton team which earned the No. 2 seed out of Region 2- after finishing with a 8-9 record. 
The Lady Cougars come into the tournament hitting .309 has a team. Newnan has displayed some power this year with 11 home runs. 
Hannah Scarbrough enters the tournament with a teamleading .462 average, with four home runs and 11 RBIs. Leslie Davis has three home runs, and is batting .315 with nine RBIs. 
Shakerra Geter is batting .294 with 11 RBIs. 
The winner of the Newton-Newnan series plays the winner of the Peachtree Ridge-South Forsyth series. More
